Sentencas: Generating power from renewable biogas in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is an environment-friendly, efficient, and promising energy conversion process.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: Biogas can be used in SOFCs via a reforming process for which dry reforming is more suitable as the reforming agent exists in the biogas mixture.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: Biogas can be directly reformed to H-2 -rich fuel stream in the anode chamber of a SOFC by the heat released during power generation.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: Exploiting the heat and water produced in the SOFC for internal reforming of biogas makes the energy conversion process very efficient; however, various challenges are reported.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: Thus, indirect internal reforming is opted for which a separate reforming domain is required.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: In an indirect internal reformer operating at usual conditions, dry reforming rate is quite high in the inlet and it decreases steeply toward the fuel outlet.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: Great temperature gradients develop over the reformer, since the dry reforming reaction is strongly endothermic.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: The abruptly varying rate of the reforming reaction affects the temperature fields in the adjacent components of SOFC and hence intolerable thermal stresses emerge on the SOFC components.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: In our preceding study, we graded the reforming domain, homogenized the temperature profile over the reforming domain, and executed performance and durability experiments.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: However, most of the experiments failed due to fracturing SOFC components hinting at existence of thermal stresses.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: In that study, we focused on minimizing the temperature gradients within the reforming domain; namely, we neglected the other processes.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: To eliminate the thermal stresses, we modeled the entire module of SOFC equipped with a reformer featuring a graded reforming domain.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: We found that the mismatch between the thermal conductivities of the adjacent module components is the major reason for the thermal stresses.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components

Sentencas: When the mismatch is eliminated, thermal stresses disappear even if the reforming domain is not graded.
Titulo: Thermal stresses in SOFC stacks: the role of mismatch among thermal conductivity of adjacent components
